text: Love this place. Extremely nice staff. Pizza is always delicious. They only use fresh ingredients and u can taste it. We always get their wings too. They never disappoint.

How tremedously dissapointing. I ordered two pasta dishes to go. Both pastas wayyyy over cooked pasta was gooey. Sauce for liguini was clumpy and uneatable.  Both entrees shoved into way too small of containers. Salad was ok.

One of my go-to pizza spots.  Great pizza, great engaging staff!

My toddler sonny boy can recognize the corner where Rocco's is located and whenever we pass by, 'Hey Dada, can I has some pizza?'

Sure!

I've ordered their pizza a bunch of times and I would describe it as a great NY style pizza - thin crust, good sauce, good cheese.  One way I measure a good pizza is how it tastes the next day - Roccos pizza tastes great!

I've also had their corned beef sandwich - it was piled a mile high with quality meat and I had to save half for later.  Great deal.

What more can I say?  Its good.  Try it!

I purchased a Yelp deal $15 for $20 and was excited to try this place because of the solid reviews. Unfortunately, it was a huge let down, not just in terms of food, but also service. We ordered two of their house specialties: pastrami and corned beef sandwich $10.95 (no side included) and chicken marsala $15.95. When I presented the Yelp deal voucher, the guy manning the counter stared at it for a awhile and was like "Wot's this? So you get $20 off?" and acting as if it was some bogus creation that I was trying to scam them with. I patiently explained to him that it was a legit online deal that I had already paid $15 for this $20 voucher. In the meantime, some inconsiderate parents are letting their two young kids, who presumably just came from tap dancing lessons, clickety-clack all throughout the restaurant. Talk about obnoxious! At checkout, he wanted to charge me $16 something. I told him that total doesn't seem right. He tells me that he is only taking $5 off the bill so I had to reexplain how the Yelp deal is supposed to work. He begrudgingly recalculates the balance as $6.92 and says I can't use my credit card and have to pay cash. I'm thinking to myself that this guy is really trying my patience and can't do simple arithmetic either. Whatever, let's just get the heck out of here. Once we got home and sampled the food, we liked the sandwich filling although I had asked for rye bread and they gave us some mediocre kaiser roll. Unfortunately, the chicken marsala was subpar. The marsala sauce was very subtle and it was more like a buttered pasta. When you take into account the relatively small portion size, it is an even poorer value. For a couple bucks more you could have Cheesecake Factory's much tastier version with a portion size of almost double. In the end, mediocre food + crappy service + poor value = 1.5 to 2 stars. In the future, we'll stick with Rocco's NY Pizzeria (different owner) for our NY Italian fix.

I was a frequent Rocco's customer for the two months I lived in Vegas and was in love at first bite. My usual favorites included the eggplant supreme, cannoli's, chicken parm, and spinach pie. If you can't find something from pasta, salads, pizza, and sandwich's that do not strike your fancy, there is something terribly wrong with you. The food is nothing crazy or different, just straight up good old fashioned Italian. 

Do not leave without buying a pint of Gelato from the freezer case. They have it shipped in, but it is to die for. I highly recommend the vanilla cinnamon flavor. 

They also carry non-perishable grocery items imported from Italy. 

Rocco's is a great Italian take out establishment.

Let me say this first and foremost: I love love LOVE the sandwiches! Classic turkey is my fave and always is piled high with fresh made chips on the side. My husband is a big fan of the Hot Italian beef sandwich with au jus. Neither had those chips we like so much. We always order from Eat24 and have never been disappointed with the food or service itself. I will say though, no place is perfect and not getting salad dressing or marinara sauce here or there is bound to happen eventually. 

Today was our first bust- I tried the turkey pineapple habanero sandwich. Stale bread, hard edges on Swiss cheese, SUPER sweet. I was expecting heat from the habanero but maybe my mistake? Either way, not my fave, not their fault. The stale bread and cheese however is. I didn't finish it and not because of taste. Husband ordered a roast beef sandwich by accident when he wanted a hot Italian beef sandwich. He didn't mind it although he normally doesn't eat that, however it also had stale bread so he didn't make it past a few bites. I'm honestly surprised they let that bread leave the restaurant, I was under the impression they had better standards. 

We opted not to call the restaurant and say anything. We've had far too many good experiences to write off one not-so-great experience. We will definitely keep ordering!

Omg yes!!!!!!I wasn't expecting this place to be so amazing! We get flyers all of the time and I finally gave in and tried it out on eat 24 .I was more than impressed I wish I had gone here sooner! It puts all of the sandwich shops to shame and delivers!?! This is my new #1 ! From the fresh baked bread to fresh sliced meats, homemade cheese this place e is out of this world ! I'm hungry writing this lol  can't wait t go again ! This is a must eat !

Wonderful little place. Great pizza - real NY pizza. Owner was friendly and sat down and had a conversation with me, since I heard he was from NY. Casual place with a deli and small market for Italian products such as canned tomatoes, pasta, peppers etc. ended the dinner with a delicious cannoli.

Finally arrived to dine in with great friends as our last meal before they move. What a great family owned small business! Well then, then you get the food. My tastes are a bit weird due to medication but hands down the best pizza in Las Vegas. The crust, the sauce, everything! Also had spaghetti and meatballs...de-lish! Our friends loved their pasta choices too. So company is great, food is great and now...the service. Amazing. Very helpful taking us all through the desserts (OMG) & very friendly, happy, smiling, making sure our party was taken care of since we were obvious RoccoVirgins! We tried the Italian Ice cherry. Never heard of it, tasted it and Holy Toledo I'm hooked! Definitely will be back. I always support small business, family owned establishments. I'm happy to support this one too! Great job Team Rocco's!
Great slices and subs. Fun little italian market. Pretty random to find good Italian spot in the summerlin suburbs of Vegas. I would stop by for a slice next time I'm in the area.

Went to Rocco's to see for myself if this place was as good as most say it is.  I liked the ambiance.  Looked like a NY deli from time past.  I had the corned beef and pastrami on white with cole slaw and russian dressing.  The sandwich meat was good and tasty and generous, and the cole slaw and dressing went witih it perfectly.  The bread was perfect, very fresh.  One of the best sandwiches I have had in a while in Las Vegas.  Service was quick, even though it was a little crowded at lunch time.  I will frequent this deli again and again.
Yummy food,  friendly staff! The pizza special is perfect size,  2 large slices and a drink for $5.99!

Our order to go included fettuccine alfredo with shrimp.  Got home and found out the shrimp was not cooked, at all.  It was mixed in raw! I had to drive back there to get a new one.  I wish now I had just returned our entire order as now I'm worried someone might get really sick.  I won't be going back.

really good NY style pizza at a reasonable price with a friendly home like atmosphere. Although I didn't eat a sandwich, the tables left and right of me ordered sandwiches and they looked both delicious and generous in portion.

I was super excited to try Rocco's. I picked up an eggplant parm sandwich with high hopes. I'm from Santa Monica and we have Bay Cities Italian Deli, which is AMAZING! So my expectations are a bit high. When I got to Rocco's and placed my order, one of the gentlemen behind the counter,  confidently announced that they just took bread out of the oven.  I was now, crazy hungry and the anticipation  was killing me. I drive home with the smell of fresh bread in my truck, making my mouth water! I get into my house and savagely unwrap the sandwich like a kid on Christmas. At first glance, I thought "this is nothing like my beloved Bay Cities" I finally take a bite and my initial thought was confirmed, "THIS IS NOTHING LIKE MY BELOVED BAY CITIES!!!"  The bread is not hearty  enough to stand up to the sauce on an eggplant parm. The eggplant it self appears to be prebreaded then reheated. The entire sandwich culminated in a soggy warm mess. I couldn't even pick the sandwich up! Sorry Rocco's, I did have high hopes for finding my go to Italian Deli in Vegas, no such luck.  Back to the search.

This is definitely one of the best pizza places in Las Vegas, it makes you feel like you're back in New York again. The quality of deli meats, pastas and desserts is amazing. They make a white pizza with clam sauce and shrimp which is addictive. The chicken champagne is also out of this world. Stop in for a sandwich for lunch or a pasta entree or pizza for dinner and you can't go wrong. But absolutely stop in!

I had a salad for lunch and it was fine.

I didn't try any Italian dish yet but my guess is they are excellent.  Parking and price are fine.  Service was excellent.  Ambiance was great.  

I will update after some Italian food dishes

Just now orderd calamari, so over cooked. When I called and before I could explain, they said the website said for dine in or carry out only. I asked for it not to be NOT over cooked on the website, also website does not indeed say that it is available for carry out or dine in only.
 Hard as a rock. Wont do it again and it was a friend that said it was awesome. He must like to eat bricks.
Seems like a great cut of calamari as well just SUPER over cooked..
 Lessoned learned, never again.

Rocco's has the nerve to charge a $0.75 fee for any credit or debit card transactions. Working in the industry I know that the average fee is 2.5%. That means on $10 it cost them a quarter. I bought something for $10 and was charged an extra $0.75. It's not the point of the $0.75, it's the disrespect. If you're in a retail business and you can't afford to process credit cards or debit cards for $0.25 on every $10 spent get out of the business.

This place is excellent. My favorite part is that everything is made in-house, from the bread to desserts to salad dressing. Tiramisu is one of my very favorite things in the world and Roccos version very well may be the best I've ever tasted. The Anthony Special sandwich was incredibly delicious. I can't wait to return and try more of the menu.

Best pizza in town! Always love eating here!
I've been to the one on Charleston many times as well and they are both really good! I recommend getting 2 slices for just how good it is!

Usually have their pizza once or twice a week for lunch.  Best in town and price is great.  Daily specials offer a great opportunity to try different items.  Both hot and cold sandwishes are very good and made to order.  Although their meatball sandwishes are second to none, they are a little on the hot spicey side for my wife.  Super with a cold beer.   Although there are a half dozen tables for dining in I like to take home.  Super friendly staff.  Oh,  they also make home made potato chips that are great.
Here again... great specials and the food is worth the drive over. If you like Italian, go to Rocco's!!

My man and I had a late breakfast here on Saturday morning. It wasn't packed, thankfully cause I was starving. We ordered a large sandwich  combo that came with fresh made chips and drink. The sandwich was huge, made for four people it seemed, loaded with premium meat and fresh product, on freshly baked bread. The chips were okay, I think they needed more salt.

However, the waitress was a doll and the other people eating there were nice and also engaged in conversation. It was a good meal at the right price, and now I know they deliver!

Delicious!!  I got the Brooklyn sandwich and it was delicious!!  Huge but a great sandwich.  I had my Nephew wand daughter with me and my daughter had the spaghetti which was on the kids menu which she enjoyed.  It also was a good portion.  After our lunch I let the kids have some baked goods and they were delicious!! I got a brownie, (which was huge) and a cake ball for my daughter and they were very satisfied!!! The brownie(cake)lol was very rich and thick so beware and have milk ready!!!

How is it even possible that this place doesn't have a chicken finger or chicken wing with a pizza special. When you call a pizza establishment you're going to want one of these two items with your pizza it's so common like milk and cookies. So to me it seems like they are trying to maximize their profit. Instead of offering especial to take care of the customer to show them that they want your business. Unfortunately they are out for the money instead of the consumer, and in my book that's just wrong. So would you rather get all the money today or double the money tomorrow.

This place is Amazing!  I don't give 5 stars almost ever and especially for a deli/ pizza type of place, but this was the BEST Italian food I have ever had!    Every single detail was delicious.  The meat balls, garlic knots, pasta, it goes on and on.

Rocco's is strictly ok - borderline meh. I lived on Long Island, and know a good pizza place. That said, for Vegas my expectations are not set too high. Still, Rocco's LOOKS like a real NY deli. Of course, the uniforms on employees immediately reminds us we're not in New York anymore, though they are still a nice presentation. 

As for the food:
The 'garlic knots' are more butter/cheese knots than anything. I don't remember tasting a hint of garlic in them. 

The wings:
Ordered medium. Approximately 80% butter and  the rest what tasted like Frank's buttery wing sauce. All very buttery so far. 

The spaghetti and meatballs: The marinara is quite good. The pasta was ever-so-slightly past al dente, but okay. The meatballs were heavy in basil, and tasted better broken in pieces and twirled in the pasta than by themselves. The meatballs also had large pieces of breadcrumbs inside them - which didn't affect the flavor experience, but was not the most aesthetically pleasing.

I was given the dinner portion and did not find out they had a lunch special until I paid my bill. 

For a displaced New Yorker, there a couple of places in town that truly offer the tastes of home and Rocco's is not one of them - though they come close with few items.  

Yet, the food is convincing enough that the Summerlin crowd will not know the difference, hence my giving the place 3 stars.

This place is legit and won't hurt the wallet. We stumbled upon it on our way back to our Airbnb after a long day of softball and Rocco's is a godsend. The large meatball sub was amazing and huge (14" is actually a LOAF of French bread). Aside from the generous portion (could have fed 3 people), the meatballs were among the best I've ever had and I make damn good meatballs myself. The lasagna was tasty. Garlic knots are spot on. Eggplant was good. We didn't get to the Stromboli because we filled up on everything else (oops), but I suspect it will be good tomorrow. 

We also picked up some rainbow cookies with marzipan, and Italian wedding cookies. Both were delicious. 

The service was spectacular. We were exhausted and decided to order the food to go, and the women behind the counter walked us through the menu and made recommendations. Then they gave us some complimentary pastries to remember them by.

5 stars for combined tastiness, price point, and service. TL;DR: if I lived in Vegas I'd be a regular. Bravo!

I'm from the SF Bay Area and have eaten at many Italian restaurants and delis, including quite a few in SF's North Beach. Must say I have never had any better Italian food. We ordered (or pointed to!) lasagne, a meatball parmigiana sandwich, eggplant supreme, ham-salami-pepperoni and cheese Stromboli, and cookies--oh my. Every bite was absolutely delicious, we have enough food left over to have another full dinner (really), and we spent about $15 per person. My only regret is that we didn't take home some gelato, which also looked very good. Will be telling friends who visit Las Vegas about Rocco's (and we'll be back). Anyone who lives in Las Vegas is lucky to have such a great deli restaurant nearby.
Best sandwich I've ever had! Great and friendly service. Nice and cozy. Great place to grab a bite to eat.

Went to Rocco's last night with the family. We had calamari app its was fresh and amazing. My son got a cheese pizza after a few bites of that I looked at my husband and said we should order another to go Lol! I had the veal piccata the veal was nice and tender with a great lemony garlic sauce and my husband had rigatoni zigarati (?)  Very big portion with lots of sausage! We also couldn't resist their pastry counter and ordered cookies and cakes and my son had a personal cherry Italian ice he gobbled that up in no time it even had fresh cherries in it. We will defiantly be back especially since its rt down the street for us! And their to go pizza special one large cheese pizza for 9.99 will go great this summer by our pool! ; )
Love coming to Rocco's . My boyfriend can't get enough of there pastry shells with the clustered in the middle . Employees always helpful and friendly! Two thumbs up!!! LOVE THE MARKET ITEMS
Very good pizza! I ordered a Margarita and the guys were very generous! When you check on they give you cake pop which are very delicious! So check in!

Rocco's Puts the "Deli" in Delicious!

This Italian Deli serves up scrumptious Italian delights Between the big triangle pizza slices, UNREAL pastrami sandwiches, and homemade pastas and sauces, it's like you're in New York (minus the attitude).  

The family that owns and operates this perfect place makes sure your food is just as authentic and wonderful as they are.  The quality of the people who work here is immediately evident from the moment you're greeted.  

Besides the excellent food, Rocco's sells an assortment of Italian goods, from Pizzelle and pastas,  to jarred capponata and clams.  

The desserts are pretty great too, especially the gem-like, sprinkle-encrusted sugar cookies.  Delicioso!


I don't know another place that combines great homemade food, fair prices, warm and friendly service, and a clean store like Rocco's NY Italian Deli.  

**Parents be warned, this is definitely a "mommy I want that" type of place.  Get your "no cookies before dinner" defenses up, because you're going to need them.

This place is a must eat at !! Super friendly staff --Great price and Fantastic sandwiches. When you are there I hope you have the opportunity to have May make your sandwich. She is the best sandwich maker in all of Las Vegas !! I hear the pizza and lasagna are Great also. I will have to check that out next time.

Best NY Italian food in Vegas! It was delicious, would definitely recommend this place! The staff was very friendly. Rocco's was recommended by a friend, and I was very happy with the choice of food we had ordered. You'll be seeing us again!! Thank you!!
Really good pizza and spicy chicken fingers. I love their pastrys. There customer service is good too. I give them 4stars and not 5 because its a little over priced.

I had to stop by Rocco's on the advice of Nelson Q. ..Now that's some LV Yelp love!

Walked into Rocco's NY Italian Deli and was greeted right away,Oh man I am loving this place. Whats is not to love about a place filled with Huge containers of Olive Oil,Specialty Can Goods,Meats and Deserts. I felt like I was warped into a deli in NY.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/roccos-ny-italian-deli-las-vegas?select=UgNsECqliNa4s0o_KnXXVw#7biF16aDNG33PMfFkb6MmA

The atmosphere in this place is so relaxing, there's just a feeling of happiness I get when I'm in a place like this..Anyway back to food..

I order the Pastrami & Corned Beef on rye. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/roccos-ny-italian-deli-las-vegas?select=UgNsECqliNa4s0o_KnXXVw#NwIHgyvRFpYQMC0pywW-xA Also the homemade chips http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/roccos-ny-italian-deli-las-vegas?select=UgNsECqliNa4s0o_KnXXVw#bs1ciFOH-KIXfz7GkVJqaA

If you ever saw Man Vs Food that is how I felt like when the sandwich came out. Holy Shitzz! The combination and flavor of the two meats was just heaven, add the wonderful chips and washing it down with a cream soda...What can I say but Awesome!

TODAY MY FRIENDS..MAN WON!! I ate the whole thing! (I felt light headed after though..lol!!)

Will be back to try more!

My LV Trip Bookmark #3

Chicken wings were good as were the fingers, the portion size for the price could be better.  We did not like the sandwiches on our first visit but gave it another shot to try the chicken wings and fingers.  Fry's were very good.

The best Italian kitchen in Las Vegas! Excellent weekly internet specials encourages me to try new meals but the Rigatoni Zingaro is my favorite. If you can't decide on something I highly recommend trying that!

I have a weakness for New York style pizza, and Rocco's did not disappoint! The delivery was faster than they originally estimated, which is always a nice surprise. The driver was friendly and the pizza was awesome! Solid 5 stars from me. Will definitely eat here again!
Terrible service my food was terrible. They would not refund me unless I brought it back.  I was not going to spend my gas money to return food that should have been bags right in the first place.
This place is AMAZING! GREAT FOOD.... And a Deli to purchase cheese and meats.... Along with ALL the amazing Italian desserts and cookies! SUPER FRIENDLY STAFF... And will BE BACK!

I'd like to start by making a confession.  I'm not a big fan of Italian food overall, nor do I think NY style pizza is the best pizza.

Phew...not that that's off my chest, I can get to my 5 star review!

My first trip to Rocco's was after a night out with my brother and quite a few libations.  Let me just say that the pastrami & corned beef combo sandwich does wonders for the late night cravings!  I think I got through about 1/2 of it before giving up...which may likely still equate to about 2 lbs of sandwich.

About a week later, my son was craving pizza, which is not unusual to be the case almost daily for a growing 8 year old boy.  I, on the other hand, was not craving pizza.  I recalled seeing some pizza by the slice options at Rocco's, so off we went!  My son was thrilled as the guy behind the counter cut him "a slice" of pizza.  If you weren't aware, apparently in New York, a slice equates to 1/4 of a full sized pizza.  What kid wouldn't love that?

I saw the major league baseball sized rice balls and opted for one of those.  Then I spotted a delicious looking beef dish in marinara sauce and had to learn more.  Once the "bragiole" was described to me, I decided I had to have that as well!  

My son and I sat at a little table and enjoyed what I think was maybe the best Italian dinner I've ever had!  I couldn't ask for better company, a better environment, and better food.  The whole experience easily earned a 5 star rating from me.  This may become a regular tradition for us.
Best fried mozzarella ever. The staff is very friendly and fast. A little pricey, but worth it.
Amazing place, awesome food great management. Love the deli very flavorful.  The Staten Island I was great, trying chicken parm today

I was familiar with this place because my sister used to bring me their bread, soppresatta and provolone. Stellar!!!
Tonight, my husband and I googled best places for pizza and Rocco's NY Italian Deli came up. Upon entering, we were greeted with the cheeriest hello. Alicia was her name. She asked if we had any questions, and told us where the drinks were. 
As I sat at the table, I heard her happily conversing with each and every person, asking how their day had been. She talked to every one of us like we were personal friends. We ordered an Everything pizza.
EFFFING PHENOMENAL!
We've found our place for not just kickass pizza, but a whole list of items we can't wait to try!

Best best best!!!  Everything a former NY Gal could ask for!!  The heroes are awesome. The pizza is awesome. The canolis and zeppolis are to die for!!! If you are looking for authentic and I mean authentic NY Italian, this is it!!
Fantastic New York style pizza. Great fresh ingredients and fun atmosphere. Ask for some sharp provolone to take home and they're cannolis are a must. Love it!

Rocco's is the best in town. I am from CA, so i really didn't know what authentic NY Pizza was suppose to taste like. But I heard a lot of good things about this place. After eating here, I came to a conclusion that the pizza, is effing amazing. I recommend  a plain cheese slice. For 1.99$ a slice, you can't go wrong, cuz  thats actually cheaper and better than the garbage they serve at places like Sbarro.You can definitely taste the quality. my personal favorite as far as sandwiches go, is the hot pastrami and corned beef. it comes piled high with swiss cheese, creamy coleslaw and homemade russian dressing. The chicken champagne is also fantastic. The ingredients are fresh, you can taste it in the food, which is what definitely sets them apart from your average local pizza/deli/italian joints.

I have not been to this Rocco's for almost 2 years. Last time I got a cheese pizza to go was really burnt! Today, I thought I give them another shot. I ordered the calamari, some of the calamari was over cooked & some were delicious. I also ordered a large cheese pizza, and a 12 pieces of garlic knots. I'm from New York, The cheese pizza crust was very soggy ( nothing to be bragging about their cheese pizzas) They could have cooked the cheese pizza a little bit longer to make the crust crispy. The garlic knots were delicious as usual. At the end I pay my bill with an American Express credit card.  I noticed that they charged me $.75 for using my credit card! This practice of charging customers for using their credit card is not cool at all!! So I still have mixed feelings about coming back to Rocco's. But, I think I will come back for garlic knots though.

This is a solid place to for pizza. I had the Pastrami Sandwich which was generous with meat for the price but it didn't live up to other pastrami sandwiches i have had around town taste wise. My wife ordered a large pizza and I ended up eating a couple slices and damn it was good. I am picky about pizza and will admit the "thin NY" type isn't usually my cup of tea but this one actually had flavor and hardly any grease. My wife ended up coming back for lunch a couple days later and had one of their White Pizzas. She could only eat half so I ended up eating the rest for dinner later and it was pretty good. They have a check in offer on yelp for a free mini cannoli but I'm not so much a fan of those like my wife is so I just shared hers instead of redeeming mine. 

They make bread fresh on site and sell it along with meats, cheeses, desserts, etc. The glass cases are clean but not too much pricing was posted for what was in them. Staff here is friendly and when you see them sitting down eating the food it is usually a good sign. Check out their lunch specials and they also deliver.

The cocky and condescending guys who work here actually put out some damn good sandwiches. They know it, and have the awards to prove it, too. I can't tell if they're moody and rude as part of a gimmick to be more "authentic" with the NY 'hood style, or if they're just jerks. Zero sense of humor, always seem vaguely annoyed to have customers. 

Pastrami sandwich here is pretty much a work of art. It's a contender for BF's last meal requests- delicious bread piled thick with pastrami. Just the thought of it makes him drool uncontrollably. It's his go-to sandwich at any deli, and he easily puts it in his top three bests.

We shared a featured special sandwich today: garlic bread loaded high with shredded beef, grilled peppers and onions, and marinara sauce and pecorino cheese. We opted for the "large' since we were planning to share, and received what looked like an entire loaf of garlic bread that was perhaps close to 2 feet long. Luckily, we got it to go, but the damn thing was like eating a chunk of Italy- it was essentially an italian take on a cheesesteak, and I was quite surprised with the results.  Bread was delicious, just enough sauce to make it saucy without making it soggy, and heaps of toppings. I managed less than a third of this monstrosity, but staked my claim on the leftovers early- already looking forward to tomorrow's leftovers.

The pizza here also gets raves, and I plan on trying that... along with the Bronx Bomber, or the Anthony Special sandwiches... and their chicken piccata entree with mozarella sounds amazing too. Oh hell, I overlook the employee attitude problems because they make damn good food. Just let it be known that their score would be higher if they weren't rude.
3.5 stars, rounding up.

I visit Rocco's often. We love the food and usually order take out. What I'd like to commend them on is their willingness to make me, the customer - happy. Let's just say, I ordered a pie for pick-up and when I got home it was the wrong pie. No big deal. I called them to let them know and they went beyond the extra mile to make it right. They immediately sent out a replacement pizza to my house and added a couple of cannoli for the inconvenience. This is Las Vegas food and service at its finest. They have a customer for life! Thanks again for taking great care of me!

I love Rocco's! I work nearby, and I get their hot sandwiches for lunch. The service is fast and the staff are friendly. Their cannoli is the best I've ever had! I can tell that it's made fresh since the outside is crispy. The stuffing is also not too sweet and heavy.
A friend told me about this place. Happy he did !!! I must say the food is delicious ... great service, very pleased. ((: Will definitely be back !!!  Amazing Italian cafe !!!

Sorry to say I can only give one star.....because I had ordered some Meat Ball sandwiches and the driver was late.....the sandwiches were COLD....AND barely NO SAUCE....I had asked for extra sauce on the side in which the driver also forgot....to bring....so on top of the sandwiches being  COLD and no sauce...the driver said they would go back and bring the sauce and then forgot to re deliver it.  Ha ahaha  the owner told me he would credit us a X LARGE PIZZA for the trouble and inconvenience... BECAUSE THREE MEATBALL SANDWICHES WERE ICE COLD AND ONLY ABOUT A TEASPOON OF SAUCE LOL...But every time I tried to call for the pizza the owner is never there...the girl who answers the phone act's like she has NO IDEA WHAT YOUR TALKING ABOUT AND when you ask to speak to the owner she said he is NEVER THERE?   AND THAT WE JUST HAVE TO BE LUCKY ENOUGH TO CATCH HIM....OMG How sad.  Lol...as IF WE HAVE NOTHING BETTER TO DO THAN PLAY PHONE TAG....The owner himself told me he would credit it......and I have called three times..to no avail.  Wish people would hold true to their words.  We ended up throwing the cold meat ball sandwiches away.....to the birds.  The owner seemed nice and sincere but his help the one answering the phone is in our opinions not professional.  I had left our number mqany times and never once a call back yet for the credit.  Pretty sad for business,,,because  the owner is  a nice man... i don't think that she is giving him the messages.  Oh well......what can I say?  We've had good Meat Ball Sandwiches there before...when we dined in......but not since.      :(

I've been coming here for 10 to 12 years great food,Everybody's got to check out their Facebook special's, I'm having the eggplant Parmesan and chicken francese tonight. My server is May and she is always helpful and friendly and quick with a smile I recommend Rocko's too everybody.
What a rip off,meat ball sub only 2 meatballs and a trace of sauce and a stale bun.

Never a bad experience here always good food and friendly service. Best cheese pizza ever and garlic knots are out of this world. Don't forget to leave a review and check in for free garlic knots and follow them on Facebook for daily specials

So we heard a radio commercial about this place and being an Italian food lover (and extremely picky eater) we decided to go here for a day before Easter dinner.  We were a little disappointed when we got there and discovered that it was not really a sit down family kinda restaurant.  But they were very accomodating and put about 3 tables together so our whole family could squeeze in.  The food was excellent, the service was awesome and they even have items you can buy!  We bought all the Tastycakes they had in the fridge, haven't had them in years!  Anyway, I would totally reccommend this place and wish I lived closer so I could go there more often.  I live in North Las Vegas, but I think I will make the trip just to go there.

Absolutely love this place!  Right up the street from my house and too easy to get a great pie from here.  My two favorites are the Eggplant Supreme (ricotta, moz, eggplant and tomato sauce) and of course their White Pizza.   The wings are decent, their home made potato chips, AMAZING!!  I have to admit I have never gotten beyond the pizza to try the pasta, maybe someday.  

One draw back and it isn't the restaurants fault, they share their parking lot with a few dance studios, and I gotta tell ya parking there to simply pick up a to go order is an ordeal...  They need to arrange some dedicated parking with the plaza owners.

We went again the other day and had the LaSagna and Anthony makes it worth the trip with his Banter besides good food. You really can't go wrong here because no matter how far you drive there from the meal you will get more than your $$$ worth by far. All the staff treat you like Famiglia and you will be back I guarantee it.

Great true Italian deli, foods homeade and is absolutely tasty. Weve gone here for years and this last visit for a birthday lunch with my family Danielle & Santiago provide top shelf Frank Sinatra class act customer service. Very reasonable prices friendly comfortable environment!
l come here weekly for my Italian French dip and I recently tried their pizza 2 thumbs up.

Inwood Triple Decker is my go to lunch!!!

These sandwiches will changed your life.

Rocco's has a really great selection of interesting beverages (non-alcoholic).
They are quick, friendly and worth every reasonably priced penny.

When you check in on Yelp!, you get a free Cannoli.

I love this place.. they are so friendly and the food is YUMMY !! Everytime I go in there... I get pasta salads, pizza, eggplant and dessert.. They have the "real deal" Italian pizzas for pick up for $14.00 .. you cant beat that, cheaper then that crappy Dominos !!

I've been getting tired of eating at the same old places and we got a menu in the mail for this place. The menu had nice pictures of some of the food and great advertising for the way they cook with fresh ingredients and lots of homemade stuff. We splurge about once a month and eat out. Most times our home cooking is better then the places we go.

We ordered about 80 bucks worth of food: 
 1. Chicken fingers (medium spice): not at all spicy but a great flavor. Nice clean cuts of chicken breasts. I'm the worlds pickiest eater and I usually don't like eatting chicken out because it never seems like it's cleaned/trimmed well.

2. Homemade Mozzarella Stix: These were pretty good, but make sure you have enough people and a big appetite as these do not reheat well.

3. Chicken Franchese: Nice full flavors without being overpowering at all. The chicken was very moist. There was just the right amount sauce to pasta. The portions were HUGE. I think I had 5 meals out of this one dish. The pasta dishes all come with garlic knots. The garlic knots were a little heavy on the garlic, but they were great =)

4. Veal Marsala: This was the hubby's dish and he's still talking about how good it was almost 2 weeks later ;)

5. A large pizza with pepperoni, sausage, and extra cheese. Again I'm a picky eater and I use to be a big Pizza Hut fan (I prefer  deep dish pizzas). I started making my own pizza that blew Pizza Hut out of the water and this pizza is on par with my homemade one. This isn't a deep dish pizza, it's not a thin crust either. This pizza was one of the best I've ever eaten anywhere.

6. A couple of Homemade Cannolis.  These weren't really my cup of tea, they tasted ok. The hubby assured me for Cannoli's these were excellent examples of a cannoli. The the cream wasn't over sweet and you could definitely taste the cinnamon used.

So in summary, this place was just awesome. It's about two weeks later and we're still talking about how great everything was and placed another order tonight to try out some more stuff. We didn't go as crazy ordering stuff this time. And last time we had enough food to feed our family of 3 for 3 days of snacking and eating leftovers.


Update to the review: 5/24/2014
We've eatten here a lot more times since the first review and it is still a GREAT place to eat. The staff is friendly and fun to talk with while placing an order. Any time we have family come to town, we order out here so they can share in the good food :) We got a salad messed up once and we called back to let them know and I think they had it remade and the driver back out to our house in less then 15mins.. CRAZY fast! We've yet to try anything that wasn't great.

Love their meatball parm sandwiches on fresh bread. Meat balls are amazing with some tasty gravy.I brought home some meatballs for my mother, and she loved them too. Very friendly staff too!!PIzza looks bomb!

Don't waste your money on the chicken marsala.....my steak knife even struggled to get through this tough piece if chicken!  What a waste if my hard earned money.  They have NO business charging that much for overcooked meat.......disgusting!

Not happy with the customer service at all. I suggest ordering for take out or delivery. The pizza Is ok. Same price as actual pizza from long island areas. But still not as good as actual NY pizza. Waited 30 min for our free cake balls they tell you about on yelp if you order 10$ or more. I asked for the status on them 2 times before walking out. I got the gnocchi and red sauce for 13.95 enough for 4 people, this was good. We also got 1 rice ball that was over priced at 5$ plus change and the small meat lovers pizza that 15$ plus change. Deserts looked good and smelt amazing as well. But the customer service was so bad I may not go again. And also. Who has sit down dining with cups and no ice also the temp was at 80 degrees the whole time we were there. Rocco my advice to you is to fly back to new york. And visit Michelangelo's to see how they treat there customers.  I was excited about dining at Rocco's but it was a big let down.

My first visit here. As a 100% Italian woman I was so happy to find all our favorite cookies!! Yummy and authentic. I ordered the rice ball with Marinara sauce...delicious. the young lady behind the counter was pleasant and honest. I will be back

I love this place. Amazing food, readily friendly people working there, just a great experience overall. Their pizza is maybe the closest to east coast I have found so far. I also really dig the chicken parm. But their signature item in my opinion are the garlic knots! Out of this woild, as we say back east.

Terrific pizza! Went here looking for a place that had more than pizza and Rocco's had the goods. I had to go for their cheese pizza special which turned out to be awesome. I also got a chicken caesar salad which went over well. Compared to the other Italian places I've tried in the area this one is the winner so far. They even had a deal where you get free cakeballs which were decadent. Next time I want to try the frozen desserts they have for sure :)

Food was great I got chicken Alfredo it was delicious can tell they make the sauce with really good parmesan cheese plus the garlic knots are fantastic 
I thought it was on the pricier side but the portions are good for 3 meals so end up being worth the money  
Would definitely recommend it

Second visit to Rocco's today  to sample more goodies for lunch!  Wow Again!

I tend to be "wordy" but it gets my thoughts across - I am NOT  Italian, but have had the joy of eating Italian foods created with love by real Italian people!

Starting with my Dad's youngest brother's very Italian wife Gloria - grew ALL her own garden veggies - special-ordered meats from a local Italian farmer who had a smoke-house and Deli, and baked her own breads all from scratch.  

Visits to Uncle Frank and Aunt Gloria's always meant AMAZING meals- she cooked all day and the whole neighborhood smelled heavenly when our car turned the corner onto their street!

Years ago, I dated a handsome Italian guy with a gracious Italian mom and the same amazing, unmistakably Italian aromas and flavors layered into delicious food I enjoyed at their home!

Sadly, I broke up with the handsome Italian guy long ago and sadly, Aunt Gloria passed away.  It's important for anyone reading this to know that I didn't ever get any of those family recipes, so WHENEVER I COOK "ITALIAN"  - it involves Frozen Pizza, grated cheese from a plastic shaker bottle, and cans of ready-made sauce.  Oh - and a bottle of wine.

So through the years I have sought out smaller, family-run Italian restaurants because  I love REAL Italian food!   

My recent move to Las Vegas, NV shook up my restaurant routines and until the other day I hadn't even tried to find a local Italian deli - well it turns out there is Rocco's around the corner from my new job!

Found it almost by accident - my first lunch order was NY Pizza Slice  - I couldn't tell NY Pizza from Chicago Pizza but it was very tasty  - the slice was HUGE and I ended up saving 1/2 for lunch the next day!  It even microwaved well as a left-over!

So I went there at lunch again today - when you first walk in the place smells like the wonderful Italian home-cooking I adore!  Everything looks inviting - they have hot and cold display cases and a freezer full of goodies, beautiful cookies and other baked goods, not to mention a dry-goods section!

Today I splurged - got Eggplant Parmesan, Marinara on the side and freshly grated Parmesan - a small container of Antipasto and GIANT SLICE of Tiramisu!

All of this was delicious and again I have leftovers for lunch at the office tomorrow!  Well - except for the Tiramisu - I simply could NOT stop myself from finishing it!

This food had  home-made quality - the folks working there seem really to care when you ask questions about ingredients or how long ago something was made - For the sizes of the servings, prices are fine!  

They do have a $10.00 minimum to use Visa etc., but that's ok.  I will go back again and work my way through their menu - not a "fancy" dinner house to be sure, but one does not need a "fancy" dinner to enjoy a delicious dinner.....
Best White Pie in Town and maybe outside of Jersey! That deserves 5 stars!

OMG! This place is great! First off, I will HIGHLY recommend the pastrami/cornbeef combo sandwich. Not sure what the shop name is for it, but hands down it is the BEST sandwich I have ever had in my life, in the world, for all times!!!
I get that sandwich almost everytime I am down there, and then on top of it, usually order a pizza (white or stuffed) to go with the sandwich. Consistency with all of thier food, never dissapointing, always delicious, and simply great food, great price and great feeling in your stomach when it's all said and done.
Now if you want some pizza, go no further than the stuffed pizza. The thing is a monster, and while it is on the pricy side, it is worth every penny. One slice (ONE!!!) is enough for anybody. I challenge you to finish 2 slices of this pie! It's a monster stuffed with so much good stuff, my mouth is actually watering thinking about it.
I gotta stop, I'm getting a hankering for some meats and pizza right now...
All said, great place. And I am not joking-I would swear it on the bible that the Pastrami/Corned Beed is the best sandwich in the world that I have ever had, and I would like to extend my gratitude to Rocco's for granting me the privelage of stuffing my face with it.

I am not much of a review writer however I am addicted to Rocco's white pizza with tomatoe and basil and want the world to know about it. Pizza is not in my normal menu and every time I think of spoiling myself I order the best in town. Thank you for the consistency and yummy food your location always prepares on time. Employees are also extremely friendly. The out won't regret eating here.
Awesome food and service!!! Authentic and all homemade....yaaaaaaa got visit.. had pizza, garlic knots, garlic fries (bomb) and meatball sandwich

Our first experience was excellent;  portions are huge, love their pizzas,  calamari, chicken cutlets is yummy, I'm not really a cannoli fan but theirs are the BEST! My kids & I  we're satisfied and pleased so therefore *5 stars & then some for their hospitality.
Amazing food, small Italian joint. Owner still very involved. Bread made here daily. HUGE portions. Be hungry or bring a friend. Get a cannoli to take home

Absolutely love this place! We got not only one but two orders of garlic knots! The staff that were working tonight were amazing! So happy, kind and helpful and of course everything we ordered was out of this world good! My husband had the lasagna and said it was thr best he has ever had!

Great place to grab lunch on the go. I had just stopped in as I was in the other side of town f on which I'm not we familiar with. It look clean & the folks were friendly. 
Thanks!
CW

So......San Tiago is the best employee!! I asked for delivery and he had no one available but then decided to deliver himself for me, I was so grateful I didn't have to call another pizza place!! Rocco's accommodates is customers needs!!! Thanks a million!

It is as good as it gets in Las Vegas is how the title should read.

Great Sandwiches, Cold Cuts, precooked Italian specialties with choice of sauces.   

The pizza is flat out the best in Vegas and completes with a New York slice of pie.

If you are having parties with all guys have them cater it - you won't be disappointed.

Jason

Not really satisfied with the quality of the food here. The pizza was really mediocre. For a place to claim NY style, it definitely fell under par. The sauce was horrible, with a nasty after taste. The cheese was nothing close to special. The crust was flavorless. The food took a long time to be served, and the service was not impressive. Also, on here there are photos of Wise potato chips, they don't sell them. There are a lot of items that are shown on here that don't seem to be sold there anymore. Wasn't what I had expected and I won't be returning. And they need to take off the NY part because I didn't find anything New York about this place, besides a deli case, whatsoever.

Love this place! The best mozzarella sticks, ever! The salads are great, delicious pizza and fresh sandwiches! 
It's a small and chill environment, which I love.  The staff have always been so nice and provide great service. They also have a cute variety of bakery items.

We had their mozzarella pizza at our friend house and it was delicious but when we ordered it 2 weeks later, it was just like eating bread with marinara sauce and ranch, no cheese at all, and u know what?!  It isn't cheep either! So very disappointed with this place and probably won't buy from them again.

It has been years since I have been to Rocco's...I used to come here almost weekly for their pizza (Their White & Their NY Style Cheese) but health choices have kept me away from pizza in that frequency and I somehow forgot about Rocco's.  They recently had a Groupon for their pasta dishes.  I said to myself, "Self, remember how great Rocco's pizza is?...well maybe you should try out their pastas too huh?  And btw, since we're talking and we don't do that all that often, I just wanted to point out that you are a beautiful person...smart, funny, good looking, humble, etc....just thought I'd point that out."  I was obviously flattered by conversation, but I also decided to check out some pastas at Rocco's.

All their pastas come with a nice Italian House Salad and a couple Garlic Knots.  I went with the Rigatoni Zingaro - Sausage, Hot Cherry Peppers, Fresh Mushrooms and a slightly spicy pink sauce.  I love pink sauce!...and they did it wonderfully!  Also ordered the Chicken & Broccoli Alfredo.  Both were very nice portion sizes...easy to save some for lunch the next day.  Both came with ample sauce for dipping Garlic Knots as well :)   The Alfredo was very solid--the sauce a little thin for my liking.  The Rigatoni was wonderful!

Come here... leave the strip... 

Let me set the scene. 
Enter.... couple from Hawaii.
NY-style deli located in a tiny strip mall.
No waiter/waitress. Sit anywhere if dining in. 
Greeted immediately by a smiling man with glasses (Anthony) and a petite lady in a ball cap. 

Friendly. Warm. Reggae music piped in... Playing my jam... "Island girl" by Tribal Seeds
Yknow that gut feeling you get when you enter a place and you JUST know that you have just found a new "family tradition"?... well - that's what this experience was for us.

It was our first visit. 
Anthony offered us menus to peruse. But didn't. 
Engaged in conversation with him instead. 
They offered items in the deli case to sample (antipasto is ON POINT!, get it... thank me later!! - mortadella, capicola, sweet red peppers, green peppers... AND.SO.MUCH.MORE, perfectly marinaded)!

Here's what we ended up ordering:
Freshly made garlic knots (order of 6 with red sauce) - free with a yelp! review)
Antipasto - get it!!
Fresh mozzarella (marinaded with garlic)
Lobster stromboli (takes 15 minutes) served with butter wine sauce on the side (I drank it!)
Chicken marsala - huge portion covered with heaping pile of mushrooms. Sweet marsala wine sauce (I added parm).
Garlic bread - crispy and soft. 
Canoli 
Diet Espresso Coffee Soda "Manhattan Special" - it was good!! Not too sweet.
Cookies to bring home as omiyage (gifts for family and friends). 

I cannot say enough about how I love supporting local small businesses, learning about them, and loving the food. 
Anthony is a Las Vegas local and has 5 keiki. 

While dining in... steady stream of people (all their regulars).  They got slices of pizza, wedges of cheese from the deli (cut to their weight specifications), cookies, etc.

The walls are covered in NY/NJ license plates, photos, and a blue line American flag. This past week was a difficult one in Las Vegas. Thank you to the men and women in blue for responding so amazingly to protect so many during the tragedy. Thank you Rocco's for supporting our law enforcement! 

Service is something that often gets overlooked. I've noticed in Vegas people will want to eat at the places by celebrity chefs or the quick spots convenient to dine in on the Strip. But...
There was something about this place that was so home-y and inviting.
A place I want to bring all my family and friends. I hope you get a chance to get off the strip and come here. Talk with Anthony. 

Thank you Rocco's for the welcoming experience.  The conversation and laughs. Best service I've had during my time in Las Vegas.

I am a prosciutto lover, and this place delivers with their sandwiches! Also got a couple Joeys ital cookies and my kids had the pizza. As an Italian girl and food lover Rocco delivers! I will def be a regular. The fresh mozzarella, and offering of Italian items gives Rocco's a genuine feeling.
Sandwiches are awesome! Great deli. I love the garlic knots here too- lots of garlic :)

This is the "NY Style" pizza parlor my parentals neighbors suggested to me during my first visit in '01. The place has changed hands several times since then, but I always return for excellent white pie; Ronzoni products I've not found elsewhere; Cavatelli (I make my own white clam sauce)  and to have 'zas, sandwich trays, cannoli, Rainbow, and Italian cookies made for meetings or "thank you's" 

For imported and fresh moz, I prefer another spot, but for ok and giant orancini - most don't know better anyway - they work fine. (rice balls for L'Americans with cheese and either meat or red sauce and peas) Also prefer plain slices elsewhere, but that white pie, well done,  kicks ass. 

I've never had their other meals/cooked pasta so I can't speak to them. But I do drive 20+ minutes out of my way for that white pie. My folks enjoy the plain cheese, so if sharing we will do half and half. 

Really do miss the Daily News on the counter, and Nelson is correct: whether getting your "free" check in mini cannoli or others, ask for the filling on the side. Nobody likes a soggy cannoli. Their printed menu is pretty straightforward and the workers are all sweet. Eddie the chef told me this is the only Rocco's in town which bakes their own bread: I believe him -- and my favorite! After 13 years of patronage I can say without a doubt: Rocco's makes me a little homesick and always sated. Grazie!

I am from New York originally and until now I couldn't find edible Italian food for a reasonable price in Las Vegas. When I make large delivery orders they always throw in some garlic knots or cookies on the house !!! I have tried everything on the menu and haven't found something I didn't like yet ! The food is always on point and even after I moved farther away they still deliver to me all the way out on trop and fort apache ! I love these guys because they know the value of their customers and they show their appreciation by taking extra care. The sandwiches are always fully loaded and the meat is quality. Thanks you guys for giving me a taste of home.

Was able to get the Locatelli cheese I love so much. Sadly that is where the N.Y. Deli ends.
 I bought 1/2 lb of cheese and 2 loaves ( ? more like hoagie rolls.) Bread was doughy and not at all like the bread in NY. The market was small. Very little stock to choose from. The place was more like a fast food pizza joint with a few Italian market items. I'm still looking for a  good Italian bakery/deli.
Great food and always consistent.  Had the HUGE meatball sub and split with my wife.  We are stuffed!  Meatballs are fresh not frozen.  Everything we've tried at THIS location has been top notch!

What a great pizza place, pizza was delicious and the service fantastic.  You can really tell the staff loves working there and they take a lot of pride where they work.  Pizza was thin crust NY style, toppings were just right and sauce was delicious.

This place is to good. No doubt a local hidden gem
I eat here all the time 
Great amazing tasting food for a fair price

Been here enough to say these guys know how to make a good sandwich.  When ever I have a real NY pastrami craving it's off to Rocco's I go.  I will drive miles out of my way for the real deal.  They pile the meat nice and high and will fix it up the way you like it.  I prefer provo with lots of spicy mustard and a little mayo.  

Rocco's is a great little lunch spot but the small dining area can fill up fast, so if you are in a hurry call for pickup.  The pasta dishes I have tried are very tasty and a large portion.  I have not been able to try the pizza yet so look for my review update.  It's just because the sandwiches are so good (especially the pastrami.)

I have to say this is the worst Italian place ive had, i ordered chicken marsala which was over 20.00. It was bland, pasta was dripping with oil,  the chicken was overcooked, tough and had no flavor.  My wife was cutting it with a steak knife and it was still tough. My kids had spaghetti with Marana sauce and they couldn't finish a little bowl of it. I also ordered a pizza with ham. It was ok but very greasy and not much flavor, i spent close to 60.00 for food that is barely edible.  Dont waste your time with this place, i wont again.

It's a bit pricey but soooooo worth it!!!! The food is fresh and AMAZING!!!! As well as the customer service. Everything from the pizza, calzones, fried calamari, sausages, and desserts are absolutely mouth watering.

Super disappointed in the service we received tonight after discovering this place three years ago. I placed an order at 6:10 for one slice, one calzone, and one antipasti. I was told 45-1 hour. at 7:35 (almost 1 hour and a half later) I called inquiring about where the order was and was told it would be there any minute. Fifteen minutes later (7:50) we called back and asked for the manager and was directed to Anthony. He told my boyfriend he would immediately call his driver. At 8:10, we still hadn't received anything. I called back and was told "it will be there any minute". Basically we kept getting excuse after excuse that the driver "was supposed to come to us first but didn't". Um, not my problem. The driver called me five minutes later and asked what our address was... what??? When I told her she said "that's why I'm lost, it's the wrong number", but not the wrong street name, and our street is small. She then told us that the managers had NOT called her to find out where she was multiple times like they told us they did. Then she asked for payment, even though we paid over the phone. Of course when we opened our food, it was cold. We called back ONCE more, honestly merely looking for an apology or maybe an offer to bring more hot food right away. May, who we had spoken to several times, told us there was "nothing they could do about it now because it's the driver that messed up and was supposed to come here first". Then she HUNG UP ON MY BOYFRIEND. 
Needless to say, there are plenty of other pizza places with much better service that we will be ordering from in the future.
It isn't easy to find great pizza & wings at the same place. This place is the real deal! We will order again for sure!

After months of passing by this place I finally popped in today and I know I will be back.  I had "Da Bronx"  sandwich, the first thing on the menu.  It had three different meats, cheese, some oil and vinegar, lettuce and tomato on an italian roll.  It was a good sized sandwich and the amount of meat was generous.  I added fries and a can of soda and it came to 10 bucks and change.  The food was tasty and people working there were really nice too.

The food was very good. Huge portions! So come hungry! The service was pleasant. The only problems we had were that they gave us dirty plates when we asked for extra plates and they screwed up our check.

Been living across the street from this lil hidden jewel for six months now! So glad I found it because OMG their food is AMAZING!!!! Tonight I tried the eggplant parmigiana, and it was everything I needed it to be; tasty, fresh, and huge! Even the fries were super good! The service was warm and friendly. The hubby and I will definitely be back...soon!

Me, my princess & my husband came in to Rocco's and we are in LOVE with this place! So close to home. Food is awesome!!! It's so delicious from the items we ordered: Veal Parmigiana, Clam Linguine in white wine sauce, Dozen garlic knots, 10-piece garlic Parmesan wings w/fries, Lobster Stromboli, mini Cannolis & tomatoes & cheese is SUPERB! Even though the prices are more than most places...it is so so WORTH the $$$!!!! NO MORE MARK RICH's in Summerlin for us. WE ARE NOW LOYAL to ROCCO's. Thank you
The pizza is delicious. They have tasty dessert and sandwiches which I saw people digging into. If you're from out of town like myself, I recommend it.

Ordered a Sicilian pizza. This thing that was delivered is a waste of bread and cheese.... it is dry and super chewy like chewing a sponge! has no flavor, minimal cheese and is burnt on the bottom. I ordered from here because they claim to be the closest to NY pizza..... NO WAY! I am really disappointed. :( 
I am from the northeast and was super excited about this pizza :(  GROSS
Favorite place to get food on my lunch break at work! The food is amazing and the custo met service is great as well!

I was in search for something authentic and amazing.  Authentic I guess but unfortunately not amazing.  I can't really put my finger on it but overall was not overwhelmed.  I have had better and I have had worse. They do offer specials by the slice and of course a yelp check in which they forgot to pack in my bag .  Catering deals seem a little pricey. I would suggest decide from your self and give it a try but don't expect too much.

It's been awhile since I've had Roccos. I can honestly say the food is still excellent if not better. You can always count on great sandwiches, pizza, pasta list goes on. Sure your gonna pay a little more then other places. But your paying for quality and Roccos definitely delivers on their quality. And they have people who work there like Anthony that makes it that much better. Great customer service. Keep it up Roccos.

The customer service is outstanding. 
Food looks just amazing I tried the snack and it was perfect best pizza I have ever gotten

OH NO NO NO! We've ordered here a few times and always loved it. However this last time it was HORRIBLE, I ordered the Fettuccini Alfredo for my Husband, meatballs (app) and fried ravioli  (app) for me, and our kids got the chicken Alfredo and the penne Vodka. We have ordered these previously (except the fried ravioli) and know what they taste like. 

The Penne Vodka was pale orange, had no flavor and barely any sauce. Worse off the fettuccini and chicken Alfredo the sauce tasted like spoiled milk. The meatballs (which I LOVED before) like bad meat, the sauce was cool to touch, not even warm and they VERY heavily coated the top in parsley. The fried ravioli was the only edible thing we ordered. The order arrived 30 minutes early but all of it was luke warm? The restaurant isn't even that far from me! The food was literally uneaten, we had to contact eat24 to figure out what was going on since the restaurant had closed.  We understand that sometimes shit happens, but how the restaurant responded is exactly why they are losing a good review and customers!

Eat24 told us they are refusing to refund or replace the order and stating they always send out "made to order, fresh food" BUT OURS WAS improperly prepared and LUKE WARM on arrival  (previous orders food was always piping hot). They let us down and instead of owning into their mistake they tried to push blame off them? UNACCEPTABLE. 

It really sucks because this was becoming our go to pasta place, when it's good it's good... When it's bad, you find out how horrible their customer service is .

I am from Staten Island New York and Brooklyn New York. And I can say that Rocco's Italian deli it's definitely New York. If you want to have the experience of New York Quality Food come here five stars

A true gem of a restaurant. Authentic in every way!! 
From the sliced meats to the pizza so good you'll forget where you are!!! 
The owner is the chef and is there on site making the food perfect in every way!! And the desserts are beyond good!! My wife and I will be back every chance we get to our new favorite spot!! 
Best food I've had in Vegas!!

good stuff.  two slices and a drink lunch special - they don't charge for toppings, so have whatever you like.  
small, but very friendly and you'll see a lot of regulars pop in.  When I'm on this side of town, i'll be sure to visit for more variety.
Fantastic sandwiches...not the absolute best in town but they're pretty darn good. A little on the bland side but super fresh ingredients and the bread was the highlight.
"Meh. I've experienced better. "

this place is phenomenal!, there are Rocco's all over the city but none compare to this location on Buffalo and Charleston, all the other locations are a BIG disappointment ..don't even bother ...come to this one and I swear you will not be disappointed , the staff and food are heavenly sent.., when in vegas this place is a must!
Hi guys this is Bobby just wanted to check up on you guys all hope you all been good miss you guys keep in touch
Amazing pizza. Amazing rice balls. Everything in here is amazing. I love the specials they always offer. Being from New York we feel like home when we come in here. Keep the food cooking. Delicious.

Don't be mistaken with Rocco's "Pizzeria" as I tried to redeem my Groupon there.  Luckily their owner pointed me in the right direction and I ended up here at "Rocco's NY Italian Deli."

We ordered a side of meatballs and lobster roll and they gave us a complimentary order of garlic knots which made them even better.  The meatballs were really my favorite, well seasoned, and far superior to many of the other meatballs I've had at other local Italian deli's.

The lobster roll suprisingly had alot of lobster meat despite the price.  It wasn't fresh lobster but it was still good and we really enjoyed the garlic butter sauce.

I'm looking forward to coming back to try their pastas and pizza.  Definitely check it out!
I may have expected to much the salad was 15.95 had bacon that was old and artichokes were brown I had to toss them ... not enough lettuce unfortunately prob will not Order again
Had the Anthony Special. Delicious! Price was just a little high, but the people were very friendly.
By far the BEST Italian deli in Las Vegas.  A true gem.  Best prices and best selections...I have never been disappointed.  Try the chicken parmesan special and you will not be disappointed.

My Girl (Viki) and I had a late breakfast here on Saturday morning. It wasn't packed, thankfully cause I was starving. We ordered a large sandwich  combo that came with fresh made chips and drink. The sandwich was huge, made for four people it seemed, loaded with premium meat and fresh product, on freshly baked bread. The chips were alright. 

However, the waitress was a doll and the other people eating there were nice and also engaged in conversation. It was a good meal at the right price, and now I know they deliver!

yeah yeah we all have our spots for pizza and Italian food but if you haven't tried Rocco's on Buffalo - well you are doing yourself and your pallet for food a great disservice by not eating here and at least giving them a try before you try any other spot in Vegas for Pizza or Italian food.  Great food!  I've been going there for 7 years - I've had 1 issue (they gave me anchovies instead of artichokes on my pizza), they fixed the problem and sent me on my way with2 pieces of cheesecake - now I didn't want the cheesecake but DAMN am I glad they gave me that cheesecake I ended up going back the same day for more cheesecake!   

The service has always been great and they have always been friendly - they are reasonably priced with exception to the wings (I think they are a little pricey but I still order them from time to time). The food is consistent and GREAT - go try the cheesecake it puts a certain "factory" to shame!

They're in Las Vegas, not in Italy. But they may as well be in Italy cuz their cannolis remind me tons of the one I had in Napoli, Italia! The crisp, the filling, the flavor. Maybe not as big, but spot on the crispy filled flavor.

Lobster stromboli!!! Oh yes! Sorry Sebastian; ya' can't sing Under the Sea anymore. 
Instead we're singing to you: 
'There you see him, 
Sitting there across the way
He don't got a lot to say
But there's something about him
And you don't know why
But you're dying to try
You wanna bite of it' (Little Mermaid fanatic)

LOB. STER. STROM. BO. LI. 
GET. IT.

Nothing fancy cuz its like a deli. Reminds me of a place in Rione Sanita in Napoli, Italia (smiling huge). I'm missing it (sigh). But nice point and pick food and desserts.

They light up too if it's your first time in or you're new. They can tell. They love it! I love it! Gotta come back soon for those cannolis!

We found Rocco's because of a Groupon. What great sandwiches!  My husband had a cold sandwich and I had a hot sandwich. They were delicious and enough for lunch and dinner for two older people.  I thought our waitress was attentive, patient, helpful. Everything you can ask for.  i don't need fancy-schmancy restaurants. The owner was in the kitchen baking rolls for their sandwiches. We will definitely become customers at this no-frills deli.

I want to try many things on their menu including the pizza and the calamari. Lately we've been to Angelina's Pizza and Mark Rich's New York Pizza and Pasta. Both were hugely disappointing. Sometimes you have to keep trying until you find a great place like Rocco's.

Ummmmm yes yes and yes!  We love Roccos.  This place is the ONLY NY Style pizza I've been able to find in town.  Even the employees are mostly from NY.  They have both indoor and outdoor seating, and we've sat both and enjoy eating there either place.  

The pies are fantastic, the entrees are also really good too.  Although, I will admit we love the pizza so much we don't get the meals from there very often...they are tasty though!  They make their own raviolis there that are reallllllly good.  

I actually go to the Roccos that is located off of Charleston by Red Rock Casino.  We go every 1-2 weeks and are always happy!!!  Any one we have sent there to get a pizza becomes a loyal customer too.  ;)  The only think Rocco's could do better is offer delivery.  They are eat in and take out only...but SO WORTH IT.  We always get in the car and drive up to see them vs. ordering delivery from a different local place.  Check them out!

I really hate to have to do this but I must revise my previous review. I don't know what happened but the last couple of times I've gone I've had bad food. The quality is gone. I recently ordered a chicken cutlet sandwich which the menu says comes with lettuce and tomato and I got dry chicken on bread with a little mayo. No lettuce, no tomatoes, no taste. Even the bread doesn't taste like it used to. I won't be back.

We were greeted as soon as we walked through the door. It only got better from there. All the food was made fresh and was so tasty...it was hard to decide what I wanted but after speaking with one of the super friendly staff members I decided to go with the Rigatoni Zingaro and I was not disappointed . My friend had the small Pastrami/Corned beef and he was equally satisfied. I will be back because this place was fantastic!!!!

We were looking for a great local sandwich shoppe, not one of the many franchise meals that are out there. And we found it Anthony was a great guy, food came out fresh, and portions are huge. We had the Buffalo chicken sandwich, thurkey pinappple habenero, garlic parm fries, mozzarella sticks, and calamari. AMAZING. Highly recommended. Will be back again.
I love the bread and the freshness of meats. The food is always great. I will be a return customer for sure. Keep up the good work.

This business has the best food, friendly service and amazing pizza.  
I recommend this restaurant to people who love Italian food. 
No pretense nothing fancy just good food.

My husband and I tried Rocco's for the first time last weekend and we don't know why we haven't tried it until now! We ordered a large deluxe pizza and it was delicious! But, our favorite had to be the garlic knots. We got an order of 6 garlic knots and we couldn't get enough. We also got an order of the zeppoles and we couldn't wait eat those. We probably had 5 each before our pizza and garlic knots! The food was amazing but the people were even better! I have been back during the week and no matter who was working, the customer service the same as before: amazing! They were incredibly kind and always had a smile on their face. That's definitely something you don't see often.
We had a pizza with pepperoni and Italian sausage. It was amazing. The people here were very friendly. I would go out of my was to go there again on our next visit.

Amazing! We tried their Everything pizza and Garlic knots! Best pizza we've had since we moved here to Vegas last year! And we've tried several pizza shops. We can't say enough how super friendly every staff member was! Well mannered and polite! We highly recommend this Italian restaurant!

I have heard nothing but good things about this place, but now I'm doubting that person's mental stability.  The place is a small New York-style deli, just as it was billed.  The food was good, but not spectacular.  We ordered garlic bread, mozzarella sticks, a personal cheese pizza and the Manhattan hot sandwich.  Everything was made fresh. The mozzarella sticks were heavy on mozzarella and the marinara dip was freshly made (and delicious).  The garlic bread was done just right, with fresh garlic and the right amount of cheese.  The pizza was average, we've definitely had better.  The Manhattan hot sandwich was good, but lacking some flavor (I felt it needed something else).  All-in-all, it was a good experience, with great service and we'd probably return to try some other things on the menu.

This was the WORST pizza I have ever had. The bottom was completely soggy and drenched in oil. We went to pick a slice up and it completely flopped down and the cheese slid right off from all the grease.

Real deal NY pizza at Rocco's. I've found places that come close to NY pizza in Vegas but if I didn't know better I would've thought Rocco's oven was a portal to NYC. I've been here a couple of times and never had anything else from Rocco's but I can tell you it's worth the trip for the pizza.

I stopped by Rocco's back in May for a quick lunch to go. Two words grabbed my attention as I walked in: Lobster Roll. I'm a sucker for almost anything with these over-priced crustaceans, so it was a no-brainer to try it. Their version of a lobster roll ($12.99) was a large hoagie roll stuffed with 1/2 lb of meat. 

They give you the option of adding mayo into the mix, but I passed. Instead, I opted for the more straightforward preparation, which was drizzled with butter and herbs. The first few bites were amazing -- lots of meaty lobster and bold flavors, but it was evident that they did more than drizzle butter on it... more like drowned it in butter. The bread did a good job of soaking up a lot of it, but it was just butter overload. Even Paula Dean would have thought it too much.

There's no doubt it was one of the better lobster rolls I've found in town, but the butter made it tough to finish. Towards the end, I just ditched the bread and finished up the lobster. If they ease up on the butter they'd have a real winner on their hands.

3.5 Stars

They sell pizza by the slice, so originally that was the plan. On the way in though I noticed a pizza special on the window for a $9.99 large (pick-up/carryout). I thought that was a great price to try out their pizza and this way it would be a freshly made pizza. Walking in it looked like a typical deli. There were tables inside and the usual pasta, tomato sauce, etc. for sale. The olives, meats and sweets they offer look very good, but they have no prices on anything. There are plenty of signs along the glass case promoting catering and their win on "Sandwich Wars" yet nothing saying how much per pound or per slice anything was. Maybe they were changing out prices and I came at an off time, but if I have to ask how much something is... I'm more than likely to just pass all together. 

The guy who took the order was nice and when I showed him my yelp check-in deal for a free "Mini Cannoli" he made sure I marked it *used* and said it would be with my order. He also said it would be about 10-ish minutes for the pizza to be made and that was cool by me. When the food was ready I checked my bag and there was no Cannoli. I had to ask for it and the girl who handed me the food acted like she had no idea about it and had to ask around. Finally, the guy who took the order came out and said "yeah yeah they get a free mini" so she went and packaged one up for me. 

The pizza deal wont be going on forever. The guy told me that they would be stopping it soon. Don't fret! If you get down here before it ends you will get a card that gets you the large cheese pizza for $9.99 every time. Score! 

Wow! The pizza was pretty darn good! I love when something as simple as a cheese pizza tastes so good. It seems lately I have been experiencing bland pizza, but not here. The sauce has a good flavor and I like the crust. I had some left over for lunch the next day and it was just as good cold! The Cannoli made for a nice dessert. I enjoyed it. 

They deliver!

I love that Rocco's offers specials on Facebook. This week we had the Chicken Franciace over linguine. It is served with 2 garlic knots, 2 large chicken breasts. It was delicious and perfect for a dinner I didn't have  to cook. When you see the Lobster calzone offered, ORDER IT! That is my favorite. These specials are reasonably priced.

OMG.....That bread though!  This bread on this sandwich!  Ohhhh, so  as soon as I walked in the door, I was greeted and I grabbed a menu, I really wanted the pastrami, but I didn't want to spend $12.95 on an 8 inch sandwich.  Specially since this was my first visit.   So I finally decided to get the Queens, Ham, Salami, pepperoni, and fresh mozzarella, with lettuce, and tomatoes.  Ok, so lets get to the bread!  I'm not a big bread lover.  I very seldom eat it. This was the softest bread I've ever had in my life!  OMG, that bread was amazing.  They bake there bread fresh everyday, and you can tell the difference.  I think the bread is what makes the sandwich.  Only thing I think (my) sandwich needed was some onions, and pickles, and I would have give them 6 stars!  They also don't have bags of chips.....But they bake there own!  They were so good, it just wasn't enough!  lol  So my next adventure here is going to be is the Lobster Stromboli!  Lobster meat cooked in butter garlic sauce for $12.95.  Ummm Pastrami or Lobster Stromboli! Not a hard decision at all! I'm going to bring my hubby with me so he can try something as well.

Paid $45 for dinner and dessert...eat dinner, paid our bill and requested our dessert. Waited 15 minutes, no dessert. Went to the clerk to check status on our dessert. She said my apologies. We waited another 15 minutes...still no dessert, so we walked out without dessert.  Crappy customer service!!
Awesome place amazing food and great service. The pizza, calzone, garlic knots and mozzarella sticks were delicious. I will absolutely come back.

Finally a NY PIzZA place that lives up to the name. I drive from across town just to eat here. The pizza is why i went here which does not disappoint, but i immediately started picking everything in sight from the cases. The meats are cust fresh for the sandwhiches, not boars head but Citterio meat and the fresh mozzarella is the icing on the cake! Love this place wish they would open another location on the east side of town. PS they do accept debit and credit cards, i saw in another review that they did not.

Came here for redemption the next day after being turned down by the mofos at Secret(ly Pathetic) Pizza. I've tried White Pizzas all around town, and the version served here is the best, IMO, even better than the Rocco's at Charleston.
